item.title: Russell Brand: BBC and Channel 4 investigate allegations
item.description: Comedian Russell Brand has denied sexual assault allegations, with scrutiny also on the TV business.

item.title: Russell Brand allegations: What is the star accused of?
item.description: The comedian and actor denies serious allegations about his behaviour over a period of seven years.

item.title: Brexit: Labour will seek re-write of deal, Starmer says
item.description: The agreement is due for review in 2025, which the Labour leader says is a key moment to reset relations.

item.title: Covid: Over-65s called for jabs as hospital cases rise
item.description: The rollout has been brought forward as a precaution against a highly-mutated new Covid variant.

item.title: War in Ukraine: Is the counter-offensive making progress?
item.description: Ukraine's generals say they have broken through Russia's first line of defence in the south.

item.title: Ryanair and family locked in Â£165 check-in row
item.description: Damian Lloyd says his family had checked in for a flight in advance but Ryanair says they had "unchecked" themselves.

item.title: Bianca Williams search: Officers to appear at gross-misconduct hearing
item.description: Five Met Police officers are due to appear at a hearing over the stop-and-search of Bianca Williams.

item.title: Sudan conflict: Landmark skyscraper in Khartoum engulfed in flames
item.description: Dark smoke rises from the cone-shaped tower as government offices come under attack.

item.title: Liz Truss urges PM to cut taxes and benefit increases
item.description: The ex-PM will also use a speech to defend polices she tried to enact during her short time in office.

item.title: Libya floods: The bodies left unrecognisable by disaster
item.description: Doctors are struggling to identify the remains which have been found as the death toll rises.

item.title: Pace of rising rental costs at nine-year high, figures show
item.description: Estate agent Hamptons says the cost has risen more in the last year than it did in the four years to 2019.

item.title: England 34-12 Japan: England run in four tries to beat Brave Blossoms
item.description: England edge closer to the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals, but do little to impress in a scrappy 34-12 win over Japan in Nice.

item.title: Davis Cup 2023 results: Great Britain beat France after dramatic doubles decider in Manchester
item.description: Dan Evans and Neal Skupski save four match points before winning a nerve-wracking Davis Cup decider against France.

item.title: The Papers: More Brand reaction and Unite 'launches red wall push'
item.description: Monday's papers continue to focus on allegations made against comedian Russell Brand.

item.title: Inside South Africa's Operation Dudula vigilantes: 'Why we hate foreigners'
item.description: BBC Africa Eye gains rare access to Operation Dudula, South Africa's prominent anti-migrant movement.

item.title: Jill Dando: Murdered BBC presenter was 'just in wrong place at wrong time'
item.description: The late star's brother hopes a new docuseries, Who Killed Jill Dando?, will jog somebody's memory.

item.title: Married At First Sight cast just saw me as Ella, says trans bride
item.description: Ella Morgan Clark will be the first trans woman to walk down the aisle on Married At First Sight.

item.title: How the fentanyl crisis' fourth wave has hit every corner of the US
item.description: The epidemic's staggering scale and infiltration of communities is laid bare in a new study.

item.title: Boys From the Blackstuff: James Graham and Barry Sloane on reviving landmark 1980s TV drama
item.description: Boys From the Blackstuff regularly appears on lists of the greatest TV shows ever. Now it's on stage.

item.title: Necropolis Railway: The train trip where only some passengers returned
item.description: When London's burial grounds started to overflow, a rail route began for mourners - and their dead.

item.title: Who is Russell Brand? His journey from Hollywood star to conspiracy theory videos
item.description: The comedian, actor and activist has hosted programmes for Channel 4, Radio X, MTV and the BBC.

item.title: How will museums of tomorrow tell the Covid pandemic story?
item.description: Some museums saw the pandemic as real-time history and collected artefacts. What did they choose?

item.title: The Libyan city that's become a barren wasteland with a smell of death
item.description: With lives in Libya washed away, anger mounts as people ask why they were told to stay at home.

item.title: What will happen next for Wilko and its workers?
item.description: The retailer has collapsed and will disappear from the High Street, but will continue online.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'reflections'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Laura Kuenssberg: Labour - damned if they dare, damned if they don't?
item.description: When Keir Starmer unveils a policy it is roundly attacked - is this the price of getting a hearing?

item.title: How I lost Â£120,000 to romance scam gaslighting
item.description: As a BBC drama about a romance scam airs, one victim details how she lost a huge sum.

item.title: Eye-watering sized onion 'sets new world record' at Harrogate show
item.description: Show organisers in Harrogate believe Gareth Griffin's enormous onion is the world's largest.

item.title: 20mph: Wales first UK nation to drop speed limit from 30mph
item.description: The default speed limit for built-up areas across Wales reduces from 30mph to 20mph on Sunday.

item.title: Kent woman called 999 from hospital over care concerns
item.description: Ava Stanley from Higham says she "thought she was going to die" when nurses ignored her heart monitor.

item.title: Ronnie MacKinnon: Former Rangers and Scotland centre-half dies at 83
item.description: Former Rangers and Scotland defender Ronnie MacKinnon passes away at the age of 83.

item.title: Manchester: Workman dies as wall collapses at house
item.description: A man in his 40s died despite efforts of emergency service workers to save him

item.title: Sudan conflict: Risking lives to bury the dead in Omdurman
item.description: Zeinab Mohamed Salih writes about how dangerous it was to bury her grandmother in war-hit Sudan.

item.title: Hugh Jackman and wife Deborra-Lee Furness set to divorce after 27 years
item.description: The Wolverine star says he and Deborra-Lee Furness will now "pursue our individual growth".

item.title: What anger over top influencer says about China today
item.description: Li Jiaqi's comments struck a raw nerve as China's youth struggle to find jobs in a sputtering economy.

item.title: Store owner gets shoplifters 9 times a day and no police help
item.description: His situation is seen in small shops across the country, says the Federation of Independent Retailers.

item.title: Fiji shock Australia in World Cup
item.description: Fiji beat Australia for just the third time in their history and blow Pool C wide open with a thrilling win at the Rugby World Cup.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan beats Luca Brecel for fourth straight Shanghai Masters title
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he never keeps the trophy after winning a fourth straight Shanghai Masters title with an 11-9 win over Luca Brecel.

item.title: Classy Trossard strike helps Arsenal beat Everton
item.description: Arsenal move fourth in the Premier League by beating winless Everton through Leandro Trossard's 69th-minute strike at Goodison Park.

item.title: Davis Cup 2023: Great Britain's Dan Evans and Neal Skupski fight back to beat France
item.description: Watch the moment Great Britain's Dan Evans and Neal Skupski complete a thrilling comeback, saving four match points to beat France and advance to the last eight of the Davis Cup.

item.title: Rugby World Cup: Highlights of South Africa v Romania Australia v Fiji and England v Japan
item.description: Watch the best of Sunday's action at the Rugby world cup, including wins for England, South Africa and Fiji.

item.title: Real Madrid maintain perfect start with 2-1 victory over Real Sociedad
item.description: Real Madrid continue their perfect start to the La Liga campaign with victory over Real Sociedad.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: What is happening to house prices, and could there be a crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled or delayed?
item.description: Technical glitches have caused disruption at airports but passengers do have rights.

item.title: Six tips for getting a job if you're over 50
item.description: Recruiters and charities give their advice for anyone wanting to get back into work.

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Cheaper train tickets: Five ways to save money
item.description: As rail fares increase, we find the ways passengers can keep journeys as cheap as possible.

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and why that calculation matters.

item.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: What are your rights as a tenant?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen but remains well above the 2% inflation target.

item.title: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
item.description: Britain's economy is predicted to shrink in 2023 but is not expected to fall into recession.

item.title: State pension and triple lock: What is it worth and when do you get it?
item.description: A second significant rise in the state pension is expected in April under what is known as the triple lock.

item.title: Interest rates: How a rise affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has put up interest rates 14 times in a bid to slow price rises.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: The lunchbox is back after the summer holidays so here are some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.
